Sorry, I'm late to this party.

>-----Original Message-----
>From: Adam Jac=
k [mailto:ajack@...]
>Sent: Thursday, July 31, 2003 8:52 AM
>To: =
junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: RE: [junit] TestCase Dependency Hierarchy
>=

>
>
>>     john.link@... wrote:
>>     > Since other people's view was=
 explicitly requested, here comes
>>     > mine...
>
>>    Just wanted to e=
xpress my total agreement with Johannes and J.B.
>
>
>Darn, perhaps I shoul=
d've said I wanted other views. ;-)

You got it.

>Seriously though, perhap=
s the question I should've posed to 
>folks on this
>list is:
>
>What test =
runners do most ordinary folks [and not just the 
>junit experts
>who've be=
en using it for years] use most, do those runner primarily use
>collectors,=
 and do suites add value to those runners?

I drive all of my junit tests f=
rom ant and I don't use suites. Every one of my unit tests stands alone and=
 tests one functionality. I organise my tests so that they are in the same =
namespace as the thing being tested, and the ant junit task runs all of the=
 tests in a specific package before moving on to another package.

>Like I =
said, I believe that for ant and eclipse, two user 
>communities, I
>think =
the overall answer is no ... but I'd love to see some "market
>research".
>=

>regards
>
>Adam

Simon
